definitions: dark mark caused by spilled liquid, especially ink
something that damages reputation or brings shame to someone
examples: The fountain pen left a large blot on the document
She tried to remove the ink blot with blotting paper
His criminal record was a blot on his career prospects
The scandal remains a permanent blot on the company's reputation

definitions: irregular patch of color or staining on a surface
temporary or permanent discolored patch on skin or tissue
examples: Red blotches appeared on the painted wall after the rain
The artist deliberately added blotches of color to the canvas
The allergic reaction caused red blotches on her arms
Stress can sometimes manifest as blotches on the skin

definitions: loose-fitting upper garment typically worn by women and girls
examples: She wore a silk blouse to the business meeting
The white blouse paired perfectly with her navy skirt
Her vintage blouse featured delicate lace detailing at the collar

definitions: powerful hit delivered with fist or object
sudden misfortune or disappointment that causes emotional distress
strong gust or movement of wind or air
examples: The boxer delivered a devastating blow to his opponent
The hammer struck a heavy blow against the metal
Losing his job was a terrible blow to his confidence
The news came as a devastating blow to the family
The storm brought powerful blows of wind through the valley
Sailors struggled against the fierce blows from the northeast

definitions: negative consequences of an action that affect the originator
backward escape of gases in firearms or engines
examples: The military operation resulted in serious political blowback
Companies faced consumer blowback over their pricing decisions
The rifle's blowback mechanism ejected the spent cartridge
Engine blowback can indicate a serious mechanical problem

definitions: mechanical device that produces a current of air
informal British term for telephone
examples: The leaf blower cleared the driveway in minutes
Industrial blowers ventilate the factory floor constantly
He picked up the blower to call his supervisor
Get on the blower and order some supplies

definitions: marine fish that inflates its body when threatened as defense
examples: The blowfish expanded to twice its size when threatened
Japanese chefs require special licensing to prepare blowfish safely
Blowfish contain tetrodotoxin, a potentially lethal poison

definitions: continuous action of wind or air moving forcefully
examples: The constant blowing of sand made desert travel difficult
The blowing of autumn leaves signaled the changing season
Heavy blowing from the storm damaged several rooftops

definitions: sudden bursting of a tire while vehicle is moving
overwhelming defeat or victory in sports or competition
elaborate celebration or party with excessive spending
examples: The highway blowout caused the truck to swerve dangerously
Regular tire maintenance helps prevent dangerous blowouts
The game ended in a blowout with a 50-point difference
Their blowout victory secured the championship title
They threw a massive blowout for their anniversary celebration
The corporate blowout featured live entertainment and gourmet catering

definitions: thick layer of fat beneath skin of whales and marine mammals
examples: Whale blubber provides insulation in freezing ocean waters
Historic whalers processed blubber into valuable lamp oil
The seal's blubber layer can be several inches thick

definitions: primary color between green and violet in spectrum
feeling of sadness or depression
style of music expressing melancholy, originating in African American communities
examples: The ocean reflected a brilliant blue under the summer sky
She painted her bedroom walls a calming shade of blue
He's been feeling blue since his best friend moved away
Winter months often leave people feeling blue and isolated
Chicago blues influenced rock music throughout the twentieth century
She sang the blues with authentic emotion and power

definitions: small bell-shaped blue flower common in woodlands and gardens
examples: Carpets of bluebells covered the forest floor in spring
The delicate bluebell is protected in many nature reserves
British bluebells bloom earlier than their Spanish cousins

definitions: small round blue or purple berry rich in antioxidants
examples: Fresh blueberries topped the morning pancakes perfectly
Wild blueberries have more intense flavor than cultivated varieties
The blueberry harvest begins in early summer months

definitions: small North American songbird with bright blue plumage
examples: The eastern bluebird nested in the old oak tree
Bluebirds returned to the garden every spring migration
Conservation efforts helped recover declining bluebird populations nationwide

definitions: blue lupine flower that is the state flower of Texas
examples: Fields of bluebonnets attract thousands of tourists to Texas
The bluebonnet blooms create stunning roadside displays each spring
Picking bluebonnets on private property requires landowner permission

definitions: large fast-swimming tuna species prized for sushi and sashimi
examples: Atlantic bluefin can reach speeds exceeding forty miles per hour
The bluefin tuna population faces severe overfishing threats
Premium bluefin sells for astronomical prices at Japanese auctions

definitions: aggressive saltwater fish found along Atlantic coastlines
examples: Bluefish travel in schools hunting smaller fish near shore
Anglers prize bluefish for their fierce fighting ability
The bluefish migration follows warming water temperatures northward

definitions: detailed architectural or engineering drawing printed on blue paper
comprehensive plan or model for achieving something complex
examples: The architect reviewed the blueprint before construction began
Original blueprints showed the building's structural framework clearly
Her business plan served as a blueprint for success
The reform proposal offered a blueprint for educational improvement

definitions: high steep bank or cliff, especially by water
attempt to deceive by pretending confidence or strength
examples: The river carved dramatic bluffs along its ancient path
Eagles nested in the limestone bluffs above the valley
His threat to quit was just a bluff for negotiation
She called his bluff and he backed down immediately

definitions: careless or stupid mistake with significant negative consequences
examples: The diplomatic blunder damaged international relations for years
His tactical blunder cost the team the championship
The company's marketing blunder resulted in public backlash

definitions: something that cannot be seen clearly or distinctly
state where differences or boundaries become unclear
examples: The photograph was a blur due to camera movement
Everything became a blur without her prescription glasses
The blur between work and personal life increased significantly
Modern technology creates a blur between reality and fiction

definitions: short promotional description on book covers or advertisements
examples: The book's blurb promised an exciting adventure story
Publishers craft blurbs carefully to attract potential readers
Movie blurbs often feature critics' positive reviews prominently

definitions: reddening of face caused by embarrassment or emotion
cosmetic powder applied to cheeks for color
examples: A deep blush spread across her cheeks when complimented
His blush revealed his embarrassment at the mistake
She applied blush to add warmth to her complexion
The makeup artist chose a rose-tinted blush for the photoshoot

definitions: large tropical snake that kills prey by constriction
long scarf made of feathers or fur worn around neck
examples: The boa constrictor can grow over thirteen feet long
Boas are popular exotic pets despite their size
She wore a feather boa to the costume party
The vintage boa complemented her 1920s flapper dress

definitions: uncastrated male pig or wild ancestor of domestic pigs
examples: The wild boar charged through the forest undergrowth aggressively
Medieval hunters considered boar the most dangerous prey
Farm boars are kept separate from other livestock

definitions: long flat piece of wood or similar material
group of people managing or directing an organization
regular meals provided in exchange for payment or service
examples: He cut the board to fit the shelf dimensions
The carpenter selected oak boards for the flooring project
The board of directors met quarterly to review performance
She was elected to the school board last November
Room and board at the university costs thousands annually
The boarding house provided board for traveling workers

definitions: person who pays for regular meals and lodging in someone's house
examples: The widow took in boarders to supplement her income
College boarders occupied the house's upper floor rooms
The boarding school had boarders from many different countries

definitions: arrangement of living at school or lodging with meals
process of getting onto a ship, aircraft, or vehicle
examples: Boarding school provided structure and academic excellence for students
The cost of boarding includes all meals and accommodation
Boarding will begin thirty minutes before scheduled departure
Priority boarding is available for first-class passengers only

definitions: room where a board of directors meets for business discussions
examples: Executive decisions were made in the corporate boardroom
The boardroom featured a massive oak table and leather chairs
Boardroom negotiations continued late into the evening hours

definitions: raised wooden walkway built along a beach or waterfront
examples: Tourists strolled along the Atlantic City boardwalk enjoying attractions
The boardwalk provided easy access to shops and restaurants
Storm damage required extensive boardwalk repairs each spring

definitions: statement expressing excessive pride in achievements or possessions
examples: His constant boasts about wealth annoyed his colleagues
The company's boast of superior quality proved justified
Empty boasts without evidence damage credibility over time

definitions: act of talking with excessive pride about achievements
examples: His constant boasting made him unpopular at work
Boasting about success often masks deeper insecurities
Cultural attitudes toward boasting vary significantly between countries

definitions: small vessel for traveling on water, propelled by oars, sails, or engine
examples: The fishing boat returned to harbor before sunset
They bought a boat for weekend trips on the lake
Rescue boats searched the area throughout the night

definitions: building at water's edge for storing boats and equipment
examples: The old boathouse needed repairs after winter storms
University rowing teams stored their shells in the boathouse
They converted the abandoned boathouse into a restaurant

definitions: activity of traveling or recreation in boats on water
examples: Summer boating on the lake attracted many tourists
Boating safety courses are required for operating motorboats
The family enjoyed boating every weekend during warm months

definitions: person who operates boats professionally or for transportation
examples: The boatman ferried passengers across the river daily
Local boatmen knew every channel and sandbar location
Venetian boatmen navigate narrow canals with remarkable skill

definitions: ship's officer in charge of equipment, crew, and deck operations
examples: The boatswain supervised anchor deployment during docking procedures
An experienced boatswain maintains discipline among deck crews
The boatswain's whistle signaled the change of watch

definitions: place where boats are built, repaired, or stored
examples: The boatyard employed skilled craftsmen for wooden boat restoration
Winter storage at the boatyard protected vessels from weather
Several yachts underwent maintenance at the marina boatyard

definitions: women's hairstyle cut short and even around head
quick up and down movement
weight attached to fishing line or pendulum
examples: She decided to get a stylish bob for summer
The classic bob haircut never goes out of fashion
The cork made a quick bob on the water surface
His head gave an acknowledging bob of agreement
The fishing bob disappeared beneath the water when fish bit
The clock's pendulum bob swung steadily back and forth

definitions: cylindrical device holding thread or yarn in sewing machines
examples: The sewing machine bobbin ran out of thread mid-seam
She wound fresh thread onto the empty bobbin carefully
Industrial bobbins hold thousands of yards of thread

definitions: small ball of fabric used as decoration on clothing
mistake in handling something, especially in sports
examples: The winter hat featured a large bobble on top
Colorful bobbles decorated the hem of her sweater
The quarterback's bobble resulted in a costly turnover
A fielding bobble allowed the runner to reach base

definitions: informal British term for police officer, especially in London
examples: The bobby directed tourists to the nearest Underground station
Traditional bobbies patrolled London streets on foot
Local bobbies knew every resident in the neighborhood

definitions: medium-sized North American wild cat with spotted coat and short tail
examples: The bobcat hunted rabbits in the desert canyon
Bobcats are increasingly spotted in suburban areas
A mother bobcat taught her kittens hunting techniques

definitions: racing sled for two or four people on ice track
examples: The Olympic bobsled team practiced their explosive starts
Modern bobsleds reach speeds exceeding ninety miles per hour
Steering the bobsled through curves requires precise timing

definitions: winter sport of racing specialized sleds down ice tracks
examples: Jamaica's bobsleigh team inspired the famous movie
Bobsleigh requires explosive power and precise coordination
The bobsleigh track features multiple dangerous curves

definitions: tail cut short or naturally short tail on animal
horse with docked tail or specific breed
examples: The dog's natural bobtail wagged enthusiastically when excited
Some breeds are born with a genetic bobtail
The bobtail horse pulled carriages through city streets
Australian shepherds often have natural bobtails

definitions: strong dark German beer traditionally brewed in winter
examples: The brewery's spring bock featured rich malty flavors
Traditional bock beer contains higher alcohol content than lagers
Maibock is a lighter colored version served in spring

definitions: informal term for human body, especially regarding physical appearance
examples: He worked out daily to maintain his athletic bod
Beach season motivated people to improve their bods
The fitness magazine featured models with perfect bods

definitions: small grocery store, especially in Spanish-speaking or urban neighborhoods
examples: The corner bodega sold everything from milk to lottery tickets
Local bodegas serve as community gathering places
She bought fresh sandwiches from the neighborhood bodega daily

definitions: fitted upper part of woman's dress extending from shoulders to waist
examples: The wedding dress bodice featured intricate beading and lace
She adjusted the bodice for a more comfortable fit
Victorian bodices were often reinforced with whalebone stays
